DOC.brief_summary: This study wants to investigate if ultrasound assisted epidural catheter insertion for labor analgesia is easier and safer to the standard epidural technique.
DOC.brief_title: Reliability of Ultrasound Assisted Epidural Analgesia in Obese and Normal Weight Parturients
DOC.detailed_description: This study has four specific aims: 1. to evaluate congruity between palpatory technique and ultrasound lumbar evaluation to identify the correct spinal space; 2. to compare between ultrasound evaluation and needle measure of skin-epidural space depth; 3. to compare between longitudinal and transverse ultrasound epidural space depth in obese and normal parturients; 4. to check the reduction of complications and failure rates of epidural analgesia with ultrasound assistance.
DOC.criteria: all women who request epidural analgesia for labor all women who present contraindication for epidural analgesia
